title: Shut Down Your Dell Inspiron (& Others) Laptop: Guide + Troubleshooting

steps.title: Click the Start menu (or press the Windows key).
steps.content: Click the Start menu (or press the Windows key). This opens the Windows Start menu. If any programs are open, be sure to close them before shutting down your laptop. Similarly, save any unsaved documents before you continue. This method will work for both Windows 10 and Windows 11.

steps.title: Click the Power icon .
steps.content: Click the Power icon . It's the circle with a vertical line at its top edge. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Shut down.
steps.content: Click Shut down . After a few moments, your Dell laptop will shut down, and you can safely close its lid.

steps.title: The blank key at the top-right corner of the keyboard.
steps.content: The blank key at the top-right corner of the keyboard. Most modern Dell laptops, including the Inspiron 15 and 16 models, don't have traditional power buttons—instead, you'll use a blank keyboard key to turn the laptop on and off. Press and hold the key until your laptop powers down.

steps.title: To the right of the keyboard.
steps.content: To the right of the keyboard. Other Dell laptops have a round power button directly to the right of the keyboard. This button can be hard to spot if you're not looking carefully, especially if you have a blue or red laptop. Press and hold this button to turn your laptop off.

steps.title: On the right side of the laptop, toward the front.
steps.content: On the right side of the laptop, toward the front. On some models, including a few different Inspiron Mini laptops, there's an oval power button on the laptop's right side. There may actually be two buttons here, but the one you'll use to power your laptop on and off is closest to the front.

steps.title: Open the Control Panel.
steps.content: Open the Control Panel. If you want your laptop to go into Sleep or Hibernate mode when you close the lid or press the power button, you can make a quick change in the Control Panel. Press the Windows key, type control panel , and click Control Panel . Sleep mode is a low-power state that's useful if you are going to be away from your laptop for a short period of time. When you wake your laptop up from Sleep, you can pick up where you left off. Hibernate uses even less power than Sleep mode, but it'll take a little longer for your laptop to wake up. This option is better if you won't be using your laptop for a longer period of time. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Power Options.
steps.content: Select Power Options . If you don't see this option, click Hardware and sound instead, then click Power Options .

steps.title: Click Choose what the power buttons do.
steps.content: Click Choose what the power buttons do . It's on the left panel. If you don't see this option, click Choose what closing the lid does . Both options have the same settings.

steps.title: Choose your power button preferences.
steps.content: Choose your power button preferences. Use the menus to control what happens when you press the power button on your laptop. You can choose different options for when your computer is plugged in and on battery if you prefer.

steps.title: Choose what happens when you close the lid.
steps.content: Choose what happens when you close the lid. The third menu controls what happens when you close your laptop's lid, and there are separate menus for On Battery and Plugged In.

steps.title: My laptop won't turn off when I press the power button.
steps.content: My laptop won't turn off when I press the power button. Make sure you press and hold the power button until the screen turns off. Also, make sure that there are no prompts on the screen asking you to close open apps or save documents.

steps.title: I still can't find the power button on my Dell laptop.
steps.content: I still can't find the power button on my Dell laptop. All Dell laptops do have a power button, though it might be tricky to find. Check the keyboard itself for a blank key at the upper-right corner. If you have this key, this is your power button. If not, the button is either right next to the keyboard, or on the side of your laptop—you may have to run your finger over the surface to find it if you have low vision.

steps.title: I just see a black screen when I shut down my laptop.
steps.content: I just see a black screen when I shut down my laptop. This can sometimes happen when you have external devices connected, or a program can't fully close before shutdown. To get rid of the black screen and shut down your Dell laptop completely, press and hold the power button until it turns off—this can take up to a minute.

steps.title: My laptop only goes into Sleep or Hibernate when I close the lid or press the power button.
steps.content: My laptop only goes into Sleep or Hibernate when I close the lid or press the power button. See this method to learn how to change what your laptop does when you close its lid or press the power button.

steps.title: Selecting "Shut down" doesn't do anything.
steps.content: Selecting "Shut down" doesn't do anything. There may be pending Windows updates you need to install, or there could be a program running in the background preventing your PC from shutting down. To check for updates, go to Settings > Updates & Security (Windows 10) or Settings > Windows Update (Windows 11). To close background processes, press Ctrl + Shift + Esc to open Task Manager —if you see any applications that shouldn't be running, select them and click End task .

steps.title: My laptop still won't turn off completely.
steps.content: My laptop still won't turn off completely. You may need to disable Fast Startup if you still can't turn your laptop off. [3] X Research source Try this: Open Control Panel . Click Power Options . Click Change what the power buttons do or Choose what closing the lid does . Click Change settings that are currently unavailable at the top. Remove the checkmark from "Turn on fast startup (recommended)" and save your changes.
